question: What could a PCF Stack trace help identify when viewing a Web Profile?

answers.content: The execution timing for the PCF
The reason for a failed query
The query linked to the Widget
The PCF widget that is linked to the query

question: Which two of the following statements describe a situation where the use of Client Reflection is preferred over PostOnChange?

answers.content: When the editable property of one widget must change based on a change in value of another widget on the same page
When the visible property of one widget must change based on a change in value of another widget on the same page
When the input mask property of one widget must change based on a change in value of another widget on the same page
When the value property of one widget must change based on a change in value of another widget on the same page

question: Which of the following situations requires a New Bundle?

answers.content: A Web service with a function that queries the database to find a personal auto policy based on the policy number and returns the number of vehicles and number of drivers on the policy
A Gosu class function that queries the database to find a check based on the check number and calls an external Web service to send the check data to the check processing system
A Gosu Rule that executes when a claim's loss cause changes and creates a history entry to log the old and new values of the loss cause field
A Batch process that queries the database to find claim that haven't been touched for 5 days and creates an activity for each claim to notify the primary adjuster

question: How can an extension entity that has no foreign keys be included in the domain graph?

answers.content: Such an entity cannot be included in the domain graph
Configure an entity that is inside the domain graph with a foreign key to the extension whose archivingOwner property='Target'
Configure an entity that is inside the domain graph with a foreign key to the extension whose archivingOwner property='None'
Configure an entity that is inside the domain graph with a foreign key to the extension whose archivingOwner property='Source'

question: Why should unit tests be independent?

answers.content: Dependent tests use too much memory and tend to run slowly
Independence makes it easier to identify a test's functional area
Independent test run faster than dependent ones
Dependent tests can make it difficult to identify the root cause of a failure

question: Which of the following types of errors can be found by database consistency checks?

answers.content: One-to-one relationships that have more than one refering entity
Differences between the logical data model and the physical database schema
Denormalized search column values that do not match their associalted column values
Typecodes that are orphaned in the database after being removed from the data model

question: Which two of the following statements describe areas that Cloud Assessments check for?

answers.content: Cloud Assessments verify that a detailed project management plan is in place and that the project will deliver on time and on bugdet
Cloud Assessments review all documented business requirements to ensure they are reasonable and identify any missing requirements
Cloud Assessments check the configuration for any changes that violate or introduce performance risks to the Guidewire applications
Cloud Assessments review the configuration of Guidewire applications to verify that base product functionality is leveraged over custom configurations

question: Why is it important to clear the global cache immediately before starting a Web Profile?

answers.content: It restarts the application server so the application is fresh
It clears the browser cache to get accurate browser rendering times
To flush the beans from memory and force queries to go to the database
It forces a logout/login process to ensure you are anthorized to sun profiles

question: A new Guidewire Cloud customer recently completed a Cloud Assurance assessment in the development phase of their implementation.Which three of the following statements describe characteristeics of the optimization backlog?

answers.content: Defects identified in automated testing of code during merges are added to the backlog
Issues identified in the assessment that are not compliant with standards are added to the backlog
The name of the developer responsible for resolving each issue is added to the backlog
A description of each issue and a description of how to remediate it is added to the backlog
A priority is assigned to each item in the backlog specifying when the item must be addressed

question: A developer is working on changes for a user story.Which of the following statements represents best practices for merging the user story branch?

answers.content: User story branches should be merged into the production branch frequently
Frequent merges of a user story branch increase the likelihood of source code conflicts
Code change should be peer-reviewed after the user story branch is merged
Developers should break user stories into development tasks to support task-level merges

question: What does a Frame represent?

answers.content: The sum of profiled data collected for a Web session
A holding area for jpg's and bmp files
A collection of Stacks
A single invocation of a profiled section of code

question: In which of the following situations can denormalization typically improve the performance?

answers.content: ends with searches
contains() searches
subselect under an or searches
hasMatch() searches
case-insensitive searches
intersect() searches

question: Which of the following statements are applicable to Git?

answers.content: The revert,rebase,push and pull operations are local and don't require network connection
Allows each developer to have a local copy of the entire history of the project
It stores information as list of files and the changes made to each file over time
A branch is cheap to create because it's just a floating pointer
A given commit is identified by a checksum and has pointers to its children

question: Which of the following statements describe when and why to run database consistency checks?

answers.content: Run consistency checks frequently during development to identify database errors caused by data model and coding changes
Run consistency checks monthly in production after stabilization of a new code development
Run consistency checks after deploying configuration changes to a Test environment to find and correct database consistency errors
Run consistency checks weekly in local development environments to identify data integrity errors

question: Which of the following statements are true regarding Web Profiles?

answers.content: They are persisted to the database and can be retrieved at any time
Each Stack represent a single trip to the database
Queries are automatically profiled
A Stack is a collection of Frames

answers.content: The entity must implement the Extrable delegate
The entity must implement the Assignable delegate
The entity must end with the _Ext suffix
The entity must have an owned foreign key pointing to the parent of the domain graph
The entity must have a foreign key relationship to another entity that is inside the domain graph

Use the AutoAnalysis button,which accepts a function name as an argument
Look through the Stack trace of the Aggregated Queries to find references to the method
Use the Find Frames option to search through the stack traces of the profile for references to myFunction

It adds a Stack to the Frame

It may be used as part of an early problem detection strategy
It helps us understand a customer's business profile

When archiving begins

question: A developer, who is working on a behavior-driven development implementation, is ready to merge changes for a new feature from a user story branch to the develop branch. Which two of the following steps should be performed to verify the changes before merging?

answers.content: Run all performance tests created for the implementation
Run all automated unit test created for the feature
Run all automated smoke tests against code on the user stroy branch
Run all executable specifications created for the feature

question: Which of the following are correct when using the Web Profiler for Early Problem Detection?

answers.content: Timings are of primary interest
You should limit the size of the profile to as few interactions as required
You should generate a large amount of data to get realistic timings
Queries are of primary interest

question: Assuming the query returns 13,000 result,which of the following statements describes correctly the behavior of the code?

answers.content: The code load 5000 companies into the memory and then divides them into chunks of 300.It updates the properties of each company in the first chunk and makes a commit before processing the next chunk.Once all the chunks are processed the code will load the next 5000 companies

The code load 5000 companies into the memory and then divides them into chunks of 300.It updates the properties of each company in the first chunk and saves the results in a staging table in the database before processing the next chunk.Once all the chunks are processed the code loads the next 5000 companies.Once all the 13,000 companies are processed the code make single commit

The code loads 13,000 companies into the memory and then divides them into pages of 5000.Next it divides the pages into chunks of 300.It updates the properties of each company in the first chunk and makes a commit before processing the next chunk
The code loads 5000 companies into the memory,updates the properties of each company and makes a commit before loading the next 5000 companies

question: Which of the following statements identify problems that can result from database inconsistency?

Searches may return incorrect results
Related child objects may refer to different parent objects
Navigation within the user interface may be incorrect
The Data Dictionary may regenerate incorrectly
